name: Sienna Cross
family: Illegitimate Ashford (mother was Ashford's mistress); raised in working class under name 'Cross'
title: Operations Manager, The Obsidian Station
core_wound: Grew up knowing her father was someone important who refused to acknowledge her; felt abandoned and worthless; built walls around her heart
wants: To force her father to acknowledge her and give her the life she was denied
needs: To realize she doesn't need aristocratic validation; her worth comes from who she is, not her bloodline
voice_markers: Uses working-class slang and technical jargon interchangeably
Speaks quickly when excited or angry
Rarely uses people's titles - deliberately disrespectful to authority
contradiction: Despises the aristocracy but desperately wants their acceptance; claims she's proud to be working class while resenting not being acknowledged as nobility
physical_description: Striking resemblance to Lysander Ashford (same blue eyes, strong features) but with her mother's dark hair and olive skin. Practical clothing - jumpsuits and work boots. Has a scar across her left eyebrow from a childhood accident on the station.

relationships.Lysander_Ashford: Unknown father; receives anonymous financial support; has figured out who he is but he doesn't know she knows; bitter resentment mixed with longing for acknowledgment
relationships.Marcus_Ashford: Unknown half-brother; will meet him when he visits The Obsidian; immediate attraction not knowing they're related
relationships.Helena_Cross: Deceased mother (died 5 years ago); former singer who had affair with Lysander; told Sienna about her father on her deathbed
relationships.Nikolai_Volkov: Works under Dmitri's jurisdiction on The Obsidian; complicated relationship - mutual attraction but she distrusts nobility
relationships.Rafe_Stone: Best friend and fellow station worker; only person who knows her true parentage
relationships.The_Workers: Natural leader among station workers; respected for her competence and refusal to bow to authority

secrets: Knows Lysander Ashford is her father (he doesn't know she knows)
Has been stealing small amounts of Chronium to sell on black market to fund her life
Secretly helps organize worker protests and resistance movements
Has a data chip containing proof of her parentage (genetic records her mother left her)
Developing feelings for Nikolai despite knowing she shouldn't trust any aristocrat
knowledge_state: Expert in station operations and life support systems
Understands working-class grievances and organizing tactics
Knows the layout and systems of The Obsidian better than anyone
Aware of black market trade routes and illegal operations on the station
Does not know she's about to meet her half-brother Marcus
Does not know her father is dying (neurological decline)
